筞字的基本解释

筞
cè
同“策”。

筞字的汉语字典释义

[①]［cè］
［《廣韻》楚革切，入麥，初。］
亦作“笧1”。亦作“筞1”。亦作“筴1”。
(1)驱赶骡马役畜的鞭棒。
(2)引申为驾驭马匹的工具，包括缰绳之类。
(3)用鞭棒驱赶骡马役畜等。
(4)引申为驾驭。
(5)督促；使进步。参见“策勉”、“策勵”。
(6)手杖；拐棍。
(7)拄着；拄着棍杖。
(8)引申为扶持；架起。
(9)古代用以记事的竹、木片，编在一起的叫“策”。亦借指书简，簿册。
(10)引申为予人书简。
(11)古代君主对臣下封土、授爵、免官或发布其他教令的文件。
(12)引申为策命；策免。
(13)给有功者以奖赏。
(14)古代考试取士，以问题令应试者对答谓策。
(15)泛指考试。
(16)古代称应试者对答的文字为策。亦指一种议论文体。
(17)古代用以计算的筹子。
(18)计谋；谋略。
(19)谋划；测度。
(20)古代卜筮用的蓍草。
(21)小箕。
(22)木栅。
(23)星名。即仙后星座的γ星。
(24)书

筞字的康熙字典解释

【未集上】【竹字部】　筞； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页884第20
【篇海】俗策字。

筞字的起名意思

暂无。

Policy
Basic explanation of words
Policy
cè
Same as "strategy."
Policy
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［cè］
["Guangyun" Chu Geqi, into wheat, early. ]
Also known as "笧1". Also made "strategy 1". Also known as "Ji 1".
(1) The whip stick that drives the mule, horse, and draught animals.
(2) The extension is a tool for driving horses, including reins and the like.
(3) Use a whip to drive away mules, horses, and draught animals.
(4) The extension is driving.
(5) Supervise; make progress. See "Encouragement", "Encouragement".
(6) Walking stick; walking stick.
(7) squeeze; squeeze a stick.
(8) The extension is support; erection.
(9) The bamboo and wood chips used in ancient times to remember things are called "Ce". Also refer to the book slips, books.
(10) The extension is the letter to others.
(11) Documents in which the ancient monarchs conferred, conferred nobility, dismissed officials, or issued other religious orders.
(12) Explained as a policy; policy exemption.
(13) Reward the meritorious.
(14) In ancient times, candidates were selected for examinations, and the candidates were asked to answer questions with questions.
(15) Refers generally to examinations.
(16) In ancient times, it was said that the test taker's answering words were a policy. Also refers to an argumentative style.
(17) Chips used for calculation in ancient times.
(18) Strategy; strategy.
(19) Plan; measure.
(20) Yarrow used in ancient divination.
(21) Small Kei.
(22) Muzha.
(23) Star name. It is the γ star of the constellation Cassiopeia.
(24) Books
Policy
